intro: Pycnandra comptonii, commonly known as the Compton's pycnandra, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the island's tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
